tier_1_determinative.key_facts: The prosecutrix was allegedly gang-raped by the appellants Barkya @ Barku Dagadu Hilam and Prabhakar Mahadu Mukne along with an absconding accused Navnath Mhaskar on 27th June 2012. The trial court found that the appellants committed gang rape and convicted them under Section 376(2)(g) of the Indian Penal Code.

tier_2_material.material_facts: The prosecutrix was returning by foot from her aunt's house when she was followed and assaulted by the accused. The assault involved removal of her clothing, rape, and theft of her necklace. The identification of the accused was contested, with claims of improper Test Identification Parades and prior exposure to photographs.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: Village Pandhurli, Sinnar Taluka, Nashik District, Maharashtra

tier_4_procedural.case_number: Criminal Appeal No.525 of 2016 and Criminal Appeal No.658 of 2016
tier_4_procedural.case_title: Barkya @ Barku Dagadu Hilam vs. The State of Maharashtra; Prabhakar Mahadu Mukne vs. The State of Maharashtra
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.appellant_or_petitioner: Barkya @ Barku Dagadu Hilam; Prabhakar Mahadu Mukne
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Mrs. Sonia Miskin for Barkya; Ms. Ameeta Kuttikrishnan for Prabhakar
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_respondent: Mr. A.R. Kapadnis, APP for the State
tier_4_procedural.sections_invoked: Section 376(2)(g) of the Indian Penal Code

residual_details.additional_facts: The prosecutrix's testimony was a critical part of the prosecution's case, and the court emphasized the need for sensitivity in handling rape cases. The defense argued that identification was flawed, and medical evidence did not support the prosecution.
